posts.post_content: Shoot, DacenOctavio points out that [Mycosynth Lattice](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Mycosynth Lattice) makes [Emrakul, the Aeons Torn](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Emrakul, the Aeons Torn) an illegal target. Fortunately, there *are* still ways to cast this spell on him, but they're clunkier. This will become a new mission of mine, not necessarily because it's the best most practical way to take him out, but because, well… you just ***ripped the throat out of a freaking god with your teeth***.

Posted By: Enchantment_Removal (2/24/2011 4:53:21 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Okay... When I first saw this I thought that it was for-all-effects-and-purposes strictly better than [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade). And, at least in a lot of causal circles, it is. More people run black than run artifacts, so go nuts. But I also feel like I should caution those who are eating this up all too eagerly. It simply *isn't* strictly better than [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) in constructed. In fact, catching your opponent off guard by running [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade) instead is probably a better plan. [Wurmcoil Engine](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wurmcoil Engine) is being run more heavily because of this card. Punish the decks that are playing around this removal spell with unpredictability.
posts.html:

It simply isn't strictly better than Doom Blade in constructed. In fact, catching your opponent off guard by running Doom Blade instead is probably a better plan. Wurmcoil Engine is being run more heavily because of this card. Punish the decks that are playing around this removal spell with unpredictability.

posts.post_content:
@ChumleyX Yes.  
  
I have a serious problem with this card. It warps the color pie. I'm not saying that Black doesn't destroy creatures, I'm saying that black creatures don't get spot removed. Look at Abyssal Persecutor, for example. Even he was a massive beatstick with THE drawback (didn't stop him from being really good). Black creatures have alway been designed to be MASSIVELY overcosted because of things like [Terror](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Terror) and [Doom Blade](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Doom Blade). Now what?
